data_maturity_score.evidence: Uses Azure services (ML, Fabric, DevOps) for pipelines but no mention of orchestration, CI/CD, data catalog, or quality testing, indicating basic automation without mature governance.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 maps to the "developing" level.

maturity_signals.evidence: Azure cloud stack (Azure ML, Microsoft Fabric, Azure DevOps) shows adoption of a modern cloud data platform, but no CI/CD, testing, or governance signals.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Role is limited to data preparation, model deployment/monitoring, and governance; no mention of unrelated responsibilities such as full‑stack development or ops.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Hybrid work, flexible hours, generous vacation; no on‑call or urgent delivery language.

role_clarity.evidence: Job description lists specific AI‑focused data engineering tasks without blending other roles.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low scope creep, low overtime risk, but salary not disclosed and reporting line unclear raise a modest overall risk.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: Posting does not state who the AI Data Engineer reports to.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager title (e.g., Head of Data, Tech Lead) is explicitly linked to this role.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team expansion or hiring velocity.

team_composition.evidence: Job posting does not provide details on team size or composition.

reporting_structure.evidence: No explicit reporting line is described.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Collaboration mentioned with senior AI developer and business stakeholders, but no indication of being embedded in a product squad.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Flexible working hours, hybrid model, five weeks paid vacation, and no on‑call mention suggest a healthy balance.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Internal & external trainings, certifications, workshops are listed, but no clear promotion path.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Use of modern Azure services shows technical relevance, yet lack of CI/CD, testing, or open‑source signals limits the culture score.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open‑source contributions, conference speaking, or hackathons.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Job posting does not reference code review, CI/CD, testing, or monitoring practices.

innovation_signals.evidence: Creation of a new AI Competence Center and focus on LLMs/Computer Vision indicate a willingness to explore new tech.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No language about refactoring, legacy pipelines, or tech‑debt reduction.

ai_integration_level.evidence: Role involves preparing data for LLMs and computer‑vision models and deploying them on Azure ML, but no MLOps tooling or model‑serving platform is described.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: Both tools are explicitly listed in the required skill set.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No start‑date or urgency language appears in the posting.

competition_level.evidence: No data on applicant volume or market competitiveness is provided.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Mattoni 1873 is a long‑standing Czech beverage company; the posting references a new AI competence center rather than a startup.

hiring_velocity.evidence: No indication of aggressive or steady hiring pace.

team_size_signals.evidence: Team size is not disclosed in the description.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding or financing information is provided.

role_creation_type.evidence: The AI Competence Center is described as newly developing, implying this role supports a new function.

strength_details: Use of Azure cloud services (Azure ML, Microsoft Fabric, Azure DevOps) provides a modern data engineering stack.
Company funds internal & external trainings, certifications, and workshops for continuous skill development.
Hybrid work model with flexible hours and five weeks of paid vacation supports work‑life balance.
Role is clearly centered on AI‑focused data engineering tasks.
concern_details: Compensation range is not provided, making salary negotiation uncertain.
No explicit reporting line or manager title is mentioned, leaving hierarchy unclear.
Career progression details (promotion path, internal mobility) are absent.
best_fit_details: Candidates with 1‑2 years of experience in Python, SQL, and Azure services looking to specialize in AI data pipelines.
Engineers who enjoy working on LLM or computer‑vision model data preparation and deployment.
Professionals seeking a role that blends data engineering with emerging AI applications.
probe_details: Ask for the expected salary range and any bonus or equity components.
Clarify who the AI Data Engineer reports to and the team hierarchy.
Inquire about defined promotion criteria or internal mobility opportunities.
Confirm which Azure services (e.g., Data Lake, Synapse) are part of the data platform.
Understand typical daily/weekly work hours and any on‑call responsibilities.
leverage_details: Direct experience with Azure ML and Microsoft Fabric aligns perfectly with the required stack.
Hands‑on work with LLMs and computer‑vision model integration is a niche skill set.
If able to start promptly, can position yourself as a ready‑to‑contribute candidate.
summary.overall_assessment: The role offers a solid entry point into AI‑focused data engineering within a well‑established company, featuring a modern Azure stack and strong learning support. Lack of salary transparency and unclear reporting lines are the main downsides. Overall, it is a good fit for early‑career engineers eager to work on AI pipelines.
